column1: Definition: Estimated percentage of public school students in grades 7, 9, 11, and non-traditional programs who, in the previous year, felt so sad or hopeless almost every day for two weeks or more that they stopped doing some usual activities, by race/ethnicity (e.g., in 2013-2015, an estimated 32.3% of Hispanic/Latino students in grades 7, 9, 11, and non-traditional programs in California had depression-related feelings in the previous year).
Data Source: As cited on kidsdata.org, WestEd, California Healthy Kids Survey. California Department of Education (Jul.Â 2017).
